text: The list of popes begins with St. Peter and continues through the present day. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); see Nihil Obstat. June 1, 1911. Remy Lafort, S.T.D., Censor. Imprimatur. +John Cardinal Farley, Archbishop of New York; retrieved 2013-4-8. The pope is the head of the Catholic Church. Peter was called the Bishop of Rome. "St. Peter, Prince of the Apostles," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2013-3-18. All others who became Bishop of Rome were also recognized as popes. == Chronological list of popes == The list sometimes says interregnum. This is Latin for "between reigns". It means there was no Pope; as in a Pope had died, and his successor hadn't yet been elected. === From 30 to 249 === Dates of reign English name Official Latin name Personal name Place of birth 30 to 67 Peter Saint Peter Petrus Simon Peter שמעון בן יונה (Shimon ben Yona) Shimon Kipha CΙΜΗΟΝ ΚΗΦΑC (Simeon Kephas - Simon the Rock) Bethsaida, Galilea post42/ante57 to 64/67(?)
